intro: Eriogonum aureum, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum aureum is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
